title: Apple Picking
question_text: A couple decides to go to an apple orchard to pick some apples. After searching the orchard for the best looking apples, they decide to pick $10$ apples from a single tree. When they go to pay, they figure out the average weight of each apple is $75$ grams. Can the couple speculate that the average size of the apples from the farm is $75$ grams?

choices.text: Yes, since they selected 10 10 apples, they can safely assume the average weight of all the apples on the farm is 75 75 grams.
Yes, because all samples of 10 10 apples will produce a mean weight of 75 75 grams.
Yes,  since the apples are random, we can safely assume the mean will be 75 75 grams for all samples of size 10 10
No, due to sampling variability, not all samples of size 10 10 will have a mean of 75 75 grams
No, because the Large Counts Condition is not met

solution:
As stated in the problem, the couple selected a sample of 10 10 random apples from a tree. Due to the fact of Sampling Variability , not all samples of size 10 10 are guaranteed to have a mean of 75 75 grams. Some samples will produce a mean that is greater, while some will produce a mean that is less.

Therefore, not all samples of size 10 10 will result in a mean weight of 75 75 grams.

Choice 'D' is correct.
